definitions.definition: used to emphasize that something is correct in every way or in every detail
definitions.sensetop: exactly how, what, why, etc…exactly as…

examples.text: It happened **almost exactly** a year ago.
It was a warm day, if not exactly hot.
It's impossible to say exactly what happened.
Do exactly as I tell you.
You haven't changed at all—you still look **exactly the same**.
His words had **exactly the opposite** effect.

definitions.definition: used to ask for more information about something

examples.text: Where exactly did you stay in France?
Exactly what are you trying to tell me?

definitions.definition: used as a reply, agreeing with what somebody has just said, or emphasizing that it is correct

examples.text: ‘You mean somebody in this room must be the murderer?’ ‘Exactly.’

definitions.definition: used when you are saying the opposite of what you really mean

examples.text: He wasn't exactly pleased to see us—in fact he refused to open the door.
It's not exactly beautiful, is it? *(= it's ugly)*

definitions.definition: used when you are correcting something that somebody has said

examples.text: ‘So he told you you'd got the job?’ ‘Not exactly, but he said they were impressed with me.’
